paper_title: A short note on number fields defined by exponential Taylor polynomials
abstract: Let $n$ be a positive integer and $f_n(x)= 1+x+\frac{x^2}{2!}+\cdots + \frac{x^n}{n!}$ denote the $n$-th Taylor polynomial of the exponential function. Let $K = \mathbf{Q}(θ)$ be an algebraic number field where $θ$ is a root of $f_n(x)$ and $\mathbf{Z}_K$ denote the ring of algebraic integers of $K$. In this paper, we prove that for any prime $p$, $p$ does not divide the index of the subgroup $\mathbf{Z}[θ]$ in $\mathbf{Z}_K$ if and only if $p^2\nmid n!$.
